subsection.name: Migrate Configuration
subsection.p: You need to carefully review each configuration file and set the needed parameters according to your need. You will find back more or less the same technical information, but you will need to set them in different files.
The fundamental difference is about the mails persistence. James 3.0 uses a different storage for user mails that for spam,... mails.

ul.li: Set in james23.xml configuration file the type of user repository you were using in James 2.3 (example: org.apache.james.user.file.UsersFileRepository). You also need to set the URL you was using in 2.3 (db, file,..., example: URL="file://var/users/). If you were using file, you need to manually copy the user files to the folder you have specified (example: var/users).

You can now go to JMX console and invoke the james23importer MBean. It needs two parameters : james23MailRepositoryPath (the mail repository you were using in James 2.3), and the defaultPassword(the default password that will be used to create the users).
